result.execSummary:
The defendant Sebastian S. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ****FINES AND COSTS TO BE PAID W/IN FIRST 15 MONTHS.  IF NOT PAID, RETURN DEFT TO COURT.****  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  **TO BE PAID W/IN FIRST 15 MONTHS.  iF NOT PAID, RETURN DEFT TO COURT.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  PD - Val Karls.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency, pay child support and make all court appearances.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Agent Kim Ruhle present.  Deft has the money to pay the financial obligations in full in today; deft went to room 204 to pay the financial obligations - returned with the receipt.  No further action needed today.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Agent Kim Ruhle present.  Deft has not paid his financial obligations in full.
Email sent to Agent Ruhle informing her of next court date as well as inquiring why the deft was not returned to court when the fine/costs were not paid w/in 15mos as stated in the JOC

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Discussion ensues re: unpaid financial obligations.  Deft was to have paid his fine/costs within 15mos as ordered per the JOC.  Court adjourns balance of RH to 11/4/16 @ 9:15am in order for the agent to be present or available via telephone and to allow the deft to obtain counsel since the court may impose an alternative to the non payment of fine/costs.
Review hearing on October 14, 2016 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
For Pre-Sentence Investigation

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Valerie Karls.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of guilty as a repeater; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation used in 10-CF-532 and 10-CF-533 to be updated.  Sentencing 11/13/14 at 3:00.  Bond continued.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Case is resolved.  Due to the lateness of the hour, plea hrg set for 9/11/14 @ 3pm on request of defense counsel

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Testimony taken from - P.O. Brian Miller & P.O. Zukauskas.  State rests.  No evidence presented by deft.  Arguments heard on the motion to suppress.  For the reasons set forth on the record, the deft's motion to suppress is denied.  FPT 9/4/14 @ 11:15am, JT 11/3/14 @ 9am.
to Suppress

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Val Karls appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Atty Karls filed her motion to suppress today.  MH set for 8/25/14 @ 3pm.
Appearances:  ADA Anderson; Atty Karls w/DE (I/C).  Atty Karls requests motion date, as she will be filing a motion to suppress.  Motion hearing set for 8/4/14 at 2:30.
and Procedures

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 5. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-23-14 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
